featured.text: People who learned a second language later in life used a special part of Broca’s area for their second language—near the one activated for their native tongue.
But how they used Broca’s area was different.
Hirsch looked specifically at two language centers in the brain—Broca’s area, believed to control speech production, and Wernicke’s area, thought to process meaning.
Those who spoke different languages always used the same part of Broca’s area.
People who learned a second language as children used the same region in Broca’s area for both languages.

definition.zh_def: 布洛卡區：大腦中與語言產生相關的區域，位於左側額葉。
definition.en_def: Broca: A region in the brain associated with language production, located in the left frontal lobe.
definition.example: Damage to Broca's area can lead to difficulties in speaking.
